intro: Lachenalia viridiflora, commonly known as the green-flowered lachenalia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, rosette-like growth form. The plant produces striking, bell-shaped flowers that are typically green or yellow in color, which is a unique feature among its relatives. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is often cultivated by succulent enthusiasts.
